component.summary: A free and open source space exploration game.

description.p: Explore other star systems. Earn money by trading, carrying passengers, or completing missions. Use your earnings to buy a better ship or to upgrade the weapons and engines on your current one. Blow up pirates. Take sides in a civil war. Or leave human space behind and hope to find some friendly aliens whose culture is more civilized than your own...

Finite Galaxy is is a free and open source space exploration game; it is derived from Michael Zahniser's Endless Sky, a game similar to Elite, Escape Velocity, or Star Control. You start out as the captain of a tiny space ship and can choose what to do from there. The game includes a major plot line and many minor missions, but you can choose whether you want to play through the plot or strike out on your own as a merchant or bounty hunter or explorer.

ul.li: Hyperjump fuel depends on ship's effective total mass, i.e. hull mass + outfits + cargo + fighters
Installed outfits can no longer be plundered by default
Introduced core space, used by energy generators and some other outfits
Introduced jump heat, a percentage of a ship's maximum heat
Introduced random damage attributes for all weapon damage types
Minimum deprecation from 25% to 50%, time from 1000 to 365 days
Self-destruct check is performed only once: upon boarding
Ships consume energy based on the number of bunks, to represent life support systems
Target's shields and hull are only displayed if within tactical scan range
Removed news and portraits
Removed conversation scenes
Removed planetary defence fleets and tribute
Ship categories now depend on ship's total mass
Ship explosion blast radius = total mass / 5
Ships have zero fuel capacity by default
Planets are twice as large
Distances between planets are trebled
Non-missile weapons have their range increased by about a third
Missile weapons are more powerful but have reduced capacity
More regional specialization by redistributing many ships and outfits
Several new outfits; others were deprecated
Hundreds of ship, outfits, mission, events, and map tweaks
Changed font to Linux Libertine Display
Used a space as thousands separator
Numbers display up to three decimals by default
Display per shot and per second weapon values on the same line in the outfit info panel
Display many more stats in the ship info panel
Ship details in shop above fleet overview instead of below
Fleet overview from four to five ship icon columns
More view zoom out levels
More map zoom levels
Plug-ins can add, remove, and reorder outfit and ship categories
More swizzle options
Reorganized files
Replaced tabs with two spaces
A few minor things.
